intro: Viguiera pachycephala var. simulans, commonly known as the Mexican heath, is a flowering plant native to Mexico and parts of Central America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or limestone soils and thrives in full sun. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while the flowers are yellow with purple centers. It is often used in landscaping for its ornamental value and drought tolerance.
